intro: Tetramerium crenatum, commonly known as the warty tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tetramerium crenatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
